description:
The idea is to use Ebola survivors to fill in the Gap of Health personnel and to develop trainings for different levels of Educational back grouds of the survivors.
The sucess of this is baes on the fact that the survivors are immune and can work with minimal or no protection which ois specailly imprtant in the hot and humid weather of West Africe. Each surviror has lost loved ones and and earning members and are also stigmatized by the community so will be willing to work to help others. the suggested Fininical complenstion for work done will help boost thier economic condition 
This program can then be continued after Ebola is contained to strenthen the Health system. 
My questions to the community is:
Will this fit in with the local culture ans system of beliefs?
Would the country MOH be willing to take this system forward and incorprate it into teh maintream health education system??
